cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 110 mi ENE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: expected to move north-northwest today, then turn north Wednesday evening and track very near the Georgia and South Carolina coasts Wednesday night and Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coastal South Carolina near or just east of Charleston

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to South Santee River SC (Hurricane Watch); Savannah River to South Santee River SC (Storm Surge Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Lantana FL to Savannah River (Storm Surge Warning); Jupiter Inlet FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL (Hurricane Warning); North of Deerfield Beach FL to Altamaha Sound GA (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Southeast U.S. coast from central Florida northward through Georgia, South Carolina, and into North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are likely (78% chance) with a 41% chance of sustained 50-kt (58-mph) winds; hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential inundation of 4–7 ft above ground if peak surge coincides with high tide along the South Carolina coast, including Charleston Harbor.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches of rain with isolated totals up to 15 inches possible, producing flash-flood risk in and around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, life-threatening rip currents, and a low tornado risk as outer rain bands sweep across coastal South Carolina.
